item.title: Mary add a quote by Janice Elliott
item.description: "If you look at it from another point of view, words can be very confusing. Because they are often beautiful and we have so many of them and although they are very powerful they have no will of their own, we can use them without permission-wildly, madly and get into terrible muddles." -- Janice Elliott

item.title: Mary add a quote by D. Delillo
item.description: "a traveler, the purer form, someone who collects impressions, dense anatomies of feeling but does not care to record them." -- D. Delillo

item.title: Mary add a quote by Deirdre Madden
item.description: "I write about subectivety-and inarticulation-about life pushing you into a state where everything is melting until you're left with the absolute and you can find neither the words nor the images to express it." -- Deirdre Madden

item.title: Mary add a quote by R. MacLean
item.description: "I was stumped. I always am in these discussions. Not that I lack insight or anything, it's just that I'm almost entirely innocent of opinions. Naked. It's sort of exciting!" -- R. MacLean
